docs.snippet: The South American countries, which profited greatly from the last European war, are in an even better position today to meet and take advantage of the changes In world trade which would result if a new European conflict broke out, according to a...
docs.lead_paragraph: The South American countries, which profited greatly from the last European war, are in an even better position today to meet and take advantage of the changes In world trade which would result if a new European conflict broke out, according to a study of the subject which has been prepared by Daniel A. del Rio, assistant vice president of the Central Hanover Bank and Trust Company.

headline.main: WAR WOULD AID SOUTH AMERICA; That Continent in Far Better Position to Profit Than in 1914, Banker Says WAR WOULD AID SOUTH AMERICA

docs.snippet: A fascist coup d'etat in any part of South America was held to be impossible by the Rev. Dr. Joseph F. Thorning, Professor of Social History at Mount St. Mary's College, Emmitsburg, Md., in an interview yesterday at the Hotel Roosevelt after his...
docs.lead_paragraph: A fascist coup d'etat in any part of South America was held to be impossible by the Rev. Dr. Joseph F. Thorning, Professor of Social History at Mount St. Mary's College, Emmitsburg, Md., in an interview yesterday at the Hotel Roosevelt after his return from a visit to Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay.

headline.main: FASCISM SEEN WEAK IN SOUTH AMERICA; Rev. Dr. J. F. Thorning Says There Is No Danger of Coup d'Etat There at Present NAZI PROPAGANDA STRONG But It Is Largely Directed to Stimulation of Trade, Traveler Found Radio Field Held Neglected Vargas Against All "Isms"

docs.snippet: President Roosevelt's plea for peace found an echo here. It was prominently displayed by the press alongside President Getulio Vargas's congratulatory message to Mr. Roosevelt.
